io.github.samwright.framework.controller

Interface ModelController

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TopController
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContourFinderController, ElementController, ExContainerController, ExElementController, FingertipFinderController, FingertipReducerController, HandDetectorController, ImageLoaderController, JavaFXController, KeyboardActorController, NNClassifierController, OptimiserController, PalmDetectorController, SimplifyContourController, SkinDetectorController, StartElementController, StaticColourRangeController, TopContainerController, ViewerController, WorkflowContainerController, WorkflowContainerControllerImpl, WorkflowController, WorkflowControllerImpl

    public interface ModelController
    A controller assigned to manage a Processor object.

    When the assigned Processor is replaced with a newer version, processes data, or is trained, this is notified.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ModelController createClone()
      Creates a deep clone of this (but with no model).
      Processor getModel()
      Gets the currently-managed model.
      void handleProcessedData(Mediator processedData)
      Called when the managed Processor successfully processes input data.

      Called when the managed Processor has been successfully trained.
      void handleUpdatedModel()
      Called when a new model has been proposed and the TopController has determined that the time is right to handle it.
      void proposeModel(Processor proposedModel)
      Propose a new model for this to manage.

    • Method Detail

      • proposeModel

        void proposeModel(Processor proposedModel)
        Propose a new model for this to manage. It might be a new version of the previously-managed Processor, or it might be a completely new one.

        When a model is proposed, it is not immediately accessible by getModel(), nor is handleUpdatedModel() immediately called. The TopController manages when to call handleUpdatedModel(), and does so recursively from it down to the lowest Element.

        Parameters:
        proposedModel - the Processor to propose.

      • createClone

        ModelController createClone()
        Creates a deep clone of this (but with no model).
        Returns:
        a complete clone of this (but with no model).

      • handleUpdatedModel

        void handleUpdatedModel()
        Called when a new model has been proposed and the TopController has determined that the time is right to handle it.

      • getModel

        Processor getModel()
        Gets the currently-managed model.

        If a new model is proposed, this method will only return it once handleUpdatedModel() has been called. Until then it will return the latest model to be handled by handleUpdatedModel().

        Returns:
        the currently-managed model.

      • handleProcessedData

        void handleProcessedData(Mediator processedData)
        Called when the managed Processor successfully processes input data.

        NB. This will be called from the Processor object's processing thread, which will wait until this method returns, and won't necessarily be the same thread that this object was created with.

        Parameters:
        processedData - the data the managed Processor successfully processed.

      • handleProcessedTrainingData

        void handleProcessedTrainingData(List<Mediator> processedTrainingData)
        Called when the managed Processor successfully processes a single training datum.

        NB. This will be called from the Processor object's processing thread, which will wait until this method returns, and won't necessarily be the same thread that this object was created with.

        Parameters:
        processedTrainingData - the data the managed Processor successfully processed from a single input training datum.

      • handleTrained

        void handleTrained()
        Called when the managed Processor has been successfully trained.

        NB. This will be called from the Processor object's processing thread, which will wait until this method returns, and won't necessarily be the same thread that this object was created with.
